results.title: A Million pounds a day
results.creator_credit: Sean Graham, Peter Bradford, National Dairy Council and World Wide
results.brief_description: The history of the British dairy industry over the last 150 years. Old prints recapture the early days of this industry. Traces development in quality and distribution. Features of the high standard of todays dairy produce including the breeding of high-yield cattle strains, use of artificial insemination and prevention of disease; technological aids in large-scale processing and bottling of milk and cream, and in butter and cheese manufacture; and the provision of a dependable transport network. Presented by Richard Todd.

results.title: A Midsummer night's dream: introduction to the play
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the play are used to introduce the audience to the setting of the play, to explain the basic structure of the plot and to familiarise students with specific characters and their relationships with one another. Selected scenes, speeches and actions are presented to motivate keener interest and a clearer understanding of the play.

results.title: A Midsummer night's dream
results.brief_description: The Lindsay Kemp Company in a production of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” by William Shakespeare. Hermia, daughter of Egeus is in love with Lysander, but has been ordered by Theseus, who is to marry the defeated queen of the Amazons, Hippolyta, to wed Demetrius, who is loved by Helena. The four young people flee to the forest where they are found by Oberon, king of the fairies, Titania, his wife with whom he is in ill humour, and the merry Puck. Using a love potion somewhat indiscriminately, Puck manages to effect a remarkable chain of romantic entanglements which are eventually resolved to everyone’s satisfaction. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS A MUSICAL PRODUCTION BASED ON SHAKESPEARE’S TEXT AND NOT A PERFORMANCE OF THE PLAY ITSELF.

results.brief_description: Short romantic comedy film starring Charles West, Mack Sennett, George Nichols, Florence Barker, Verner Clarges. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: A Measure of security
results.creator_credit: Robert Guenette and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Documents the range and effectiveness of the U.S. Social Security system. It is the story of four people deriving supplemental incomes through old-age, disability, medicare and survivor benefits under the Social Security programme. All lead full and productive lives that might otherwise have been blighted by fear and poverty.

results.title: A Matter of time
results.creator_credit: Arthur Allan Seidelman, Martin Lahse and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Roni Schotter, this film chronicles a 16-year-old girl’s painful period of growth as she confronts her mother’s inevitable death from a malignant tumor. In the process, she emerges from behind her mother’s shadow and discovers her own special talent. Cast includes Karlene Crocket, Rob Lowe, Rosemary Forsythe, Carrie Freeman, Kate Bentall, Malcolm Groome.

results.title: A Matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson, National Fitness Council of Tasmania and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the rugged Cradle Mountain region of Tasmania, this film points out the dangers of exposure for those who go into the mountains unprepared. An experienced group of walkers demonstrate, equipment, clothing, food, and techniques suitable for bushwalking.

results.title: A Matter of manners
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Made to improve the relations of the Commonwealth Public Service with the public, this film focuses attention on three important factors in giving service: the need for suitable office facilities in the form of counters, reception desks and entrances to government offices; The desirability of selecting counter staff and receptionists who have an aptitude for their work, expressed in the right approach to the public over the counter; the importance of systematic training for counter staff and receptionists in the fundamental and details of their jobs. Camera - Frank Bagnall. PLEASE NOTE: THIS FILM IS AVAILABLE FOR SCREENINGS TO COMMONWEALTH AND STATE GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS ONLY. THE PERMISSION OF THE COMMONWEALTH PUBLIC SERVICE BOARD IS NECESSARY FOR ALL OTHER SCREENINGS OF THIS TITLE.

results.title: A Matter of commonsense, mainly
results.creator_credit: John Cooper, L.J. Connolly and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Increasing numbers of people go boating and boating accidents are happening in increasing numbers. A variety of mariners, including some real old salts, tell of safety in different kinds of small craft, and relate anecdotes from their own experiences. Written and directed by John Cooper.

results.title: A Matter of care: a review of the work of the Repatriation Department
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the work being done by the Department of repatriation. In the hospitals the effect of the Department’s activities can be seen in terms of the actual people who receive assistance and care. Also shows the social workers helping with problems of adjustment and therapy and training classes aimed at creating new interest in life. Script and direction by Cecil Holmes.
